From Government of India, External Affails Department, to Secretary of State for Indiao Dated Simla, 18,50 hours, 26th May, 1941, Received 01,50 hours, 28th May, 1S41, XXX 2460, Telegram No.214, addressed to Kabul, repeated to Secretary of State for India. Katodon telegram No,88 March 17th, ' ' ' —. 2, Government of India had been expecting Bose would be used for Radio Propaganda from Russia, Italy or Germany, but hothing of the sort has eventuated. It seems pi'obable therefore that he is still in Afghanistan, Meantime it has now become common knowledge on the frontier that he had crossed into Afghanistan* 3* Unless you see strong objection it is suggested that efforts should now be made through Intelligence sources available to you to locate him. If he is located in Afgteuustan it will be considered whether demand should be presented to Afghan Government to deal with him under rul.es of practice.. recd. rol, cirPT: cO aV INDIA OFFICEFILE COpf Allotted to PQli.tical Depart; Q •4 / 1 Z 4 ^ 4 If 92 SECRET D B C Y P H E R OP T E L E G R A M. kuf^ M From Government of India, Ext.Affrs. Dept., to H.M.Minister, Kabul, and reptd. by former iu. to Secretary of State for India. m Dated New Delhi, 19.50 hours. 5th March, 1941. W Received 23.50 hours, 5th March, 194l e r fitsu V V V > BQPORTAhT. A A A y 1080 0 Addressed to Kabul No©82, repeated to Secretary of State for India© (? Personal) and most secret <, Garoe to Praser-Tytler, repeated to Peel. Troopers message of March 1st transmitted ’by General Staff to Military Attache. We do not intend to take any action on present information for fear of conproraising source. But have you any local, clue in confirmation? What action, if any, have you taken? If none, please do nothing on any account 0 REC». ROl.. DEf»r.pm -Previous File. . * v - POLITICAL (EXTERNAL) DEPARTMENT. ' , , \ — ' INDIA OFFICE RECORDS MICROFILM This File contains the following papers :— YEAR.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in reverse chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Secretary of State for India, the Government of India, External Affairs Department, and HM Minister at Kabul, discussing proposed actions to be taken in response to intelligence received that Subhas Bose had crossed into Afghanistan.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department
